intro: Androsace strigillosa, commonly known as the mossy bell heather, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and evergreens adapted to acidic soils. The plant features dense, mat-forming foliage with small, rounded leaves that are often covered in fine, hair-like structures. Its flowers are typically pink or white, appearing in clusters at the leaf axils, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Androsace strigillosa thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
